description: Change of use of a dwellinghouse into a Large House in Multiple Occupation (HMO) comprising six bedrooms (10 persons)(Use Class Sui Generis)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings nos:  A-10-01; A-H-02 Rev. 01; A-H-09; A-H-10; Planning Statement ref. 1710-NW1; Cover Letter dated 25/11/2019
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

| Prior to occupation of the development, hereby approved, refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, shall be provided for all occupants of the development, in the curtilage of the proposed building, and fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as, policies 5.17 of the London Plan 2016; 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012; and 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013.

| Secure accessible cycle parking facilities shall be provided in accordance with the adopted standards of the London Plan 2016. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.
Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists and increase the use of active and sustainable modes of transport, in accordance with policies 6.1, 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016.

| Certification shall be provided to the Local Planning Authority demonstrating that the party wall between 6 Twyford Abbey Road and 8 Twyford Abbey Road is designed and constructed meeting the requirements for airborne sound insulation in accordance with Approved Document E [Resistance to the passage of sound].

Reason:  In the interests of amenity for the neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy D13 of the Draft New London Plan 2019, policies 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012).
